intro: Euryops krookii, commonly known as the Cape marigold, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy, well-drained soils. It produces small, oval-shaped leaves and has a compact growth habit. Euryops krookii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
